title: (x) Woodblock Sans-serif- Poplar {Tamas}
content:
I see this everywhere, and that "R" is a big giveaway, but could someone tell me what this font is called?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [sans serif font.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20100125185431/http:/typophile.com/files/sans%20serif%20font.jpg) | 27.65 KB |
author: beek

comments.content:
Definitely not [Birch](http://web.archive.org/web/20100125185431/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/birch/) nor [Pine](http://web.archive.org/web/20100125185431/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/pine-lt) nor [Walnut](http://web.archive.org/web/20100125185431/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/walnut/) nor [Rowan Oak](http://web.archive.org/web/20100125185431/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/rowan-oak-nf) or whatever Woodblock Types there are.

SCNR Andreas
